div.p:
ELECTRIC GUITAR PLAYS
BEETHOVEN'S FIFTH SYMPHONY

Er, you're not a student
at this university.

No, I work in the canteen.
Yeah, but you come to my lectures.
No, I don't. I never do that.

Love your lectures.
They're totally awesome.

Why d'you come to my lectures
when you're not a student?

OK, so my first day here,
in the canteen,

I was on chips. There was
this girl. Student. Beautiful.

Like a model,
only with talking and thinking.

She looked at you and you perved.
Every time, automatic. Like physics.

Eye contact, perversion.
So I gave her extra chips.

Every time, extra chips. Like
a reward for all the perversion.

Every day, got myself on chips,
rewarded her.

Then, finally - finally -
she looked at me.

Like she'd noticed, actually
noticed, all the extra chips.
Do you know what I realised?

But that's life, isn't it?
Beauty or chips. I like chips.
So did she. So that's OK.

And how does that
in any way explain

why you keep coming
to my lectures?

Yeah, it doesn't really, does it? I
was hoping something would develop.
Yeah. Did you build it from a kit?

No, it came like that.
Then how did you get it in here?

The door's too small
and so are the windows.

I had the window and a part of the
wall taken out and it was lifted in.

Why do you keep coming
to my lectures? Because I like them.

Why me? Why you what? Plenty of
people come to your lectures

Why pick on me? Well, I noticed you.
Yeah, but why?

Well, most people when don't
understand something, they frown.

I'll tell you what
I don't understand.

You've been lecturing here
for a long time. 50 years,
Nabeela in the office says over 70.

And you're thinking,
"Well, he doesn't look old enough"?

No. I'm wondering what you're
supposed to be lecturing on.

It's like the university
let you do whatever you like.

One time, you were going to give
a lecture on quantum physics.

Because of the rhymes. What are
you doing at this university?

p.span: I always wanted to come here.

div.p: So anyway, am I nearly done?

You ever get less than
a first, then it's over.

p.span: Every time, or I stop immediately.

div.p: I'm not part of the university.
We'll sort all that out later.

You kind of have
to sort that out earlier.

Leave it with me.
I'm assuming that it's a yes.

Yes.
I'll see you at 6pm every weekday.

I don't care who's dying -
never, ever be late.
People just call you the Doctor?

But Doctor's not a name.
I can't just call you Doctor.

The passage of time is an illusion,
and life is the magician.

Because life only lets you
see one day at a time.

you hope you're going
to be alive tomorrow.

So it feels like you're travelling
from one to the other.

Movies don't really move.
BELL CHIMES

They're just pictures,
lots and lots of pictures.

All of them still, none of them
moving. Just frozen moments.

But if you experience those
pictures one after the other,
You know you're my foster mum?

Am I going to have to break
every bone in his body?
You need to keep your eye on men.

Men aren't where I keep my eye,
actually.

Imagine if time
all happened at once...

..every moment of your life
laid out around you...

..like a city. Streets full
of buildings made of days.

The day you were born,
the day you die.

The day you fall in love,
the day that love ends.

A whole city built from triumph
and heartbreak and boredom

and laughter and cutting
your toenails.

It's the best place
you will ever be.

Time is a structure
relative to ourselves.

Time is the space made by our lives
where we stand together, forever.
You're not supposed to get involved.
What are you teaching her anyway?

Well, how can you teach
anyone everything?

Links apple and alpha,
synchronous and diverging...
Yeah, you want to turn that.

The door upstairs,
how did you set the security?
So turn it, and then it'll...

Sorry, can I ask -
what's that in your eye?
It's just a defect in the iris.

Looks like a star.
Well, it's a defect.

At least it's a defect that looks
like a star. I'm getting it fixed.

Sorry. None of my business, but are
you freaking out about something?

Please. You can say no.
Would you come with me?

I love this place, don't you?
Hate it.
Why? I don't know. I just do.

Everywhere I go
I just want to leave.
But it hasn't rained for a week.

Yeah, but, well, you know, half
the students here are blokes...

You want me to look in a puddle?
Please.

What am I looking at?
Your reflection.

Yep. There it is.
Do you see what's wrong with it?
My name's Bill, by the way.
Nothing. It just looks like me.
That's me, that's my face, but...

# Oh, what fun it is to ride
in a one-horse open sleigh... #
You go places, I can tell.

"With some people you can smell
the wind in their clothes."
She died when I was a baby.

If she died when you were a baby,
when did she say that?

I'm supposed to look like her,
but I don't really know.
She hated having her picture taken.

But if someone's gone,
do pictures really help?

I thought you'd enjoy choosing
something for yourself,

I hope you didn't
spend too much on this.

Ooh, I found that at the
back of the cupboard

with all your old stuff.
Just photographs of your mum.

You said you needed
a crane to lift your box.
Still making eyes at a puddle?

Did you ever work out what was
wrong with your reflection?

ALIEN VOICE: Pilot confirmed.
Pilot engaged.

She said it was a defect,
but what kind of defect
puts a star in your eye?

But that doesn't even matter
because she was right.

There was something wrong
when you looked in the puddle.

That was definitely my face.
I see my face all the time.

I've never liked it,
it's all over the place.

It's always doing expressions
when I'm trying to be enigmatic.

and there was something wrong
with my face in the puddle.

What could be wrong
with your own face?
Why do you run like that? Like what?

Like a penguin with
its arse on fire.

You seem a bit flexible
on the subject.

Maybe it's got to do with
that thing in her eye. How?

Maybe she's like...affected
by something. Like what?

I don't know. Look, I know you
know lots of stuff about,

well, basically everything,
but do you know any sci-fi?

I saw this thing on Netflix.
Lizards in people's brains.

Right. So, you meet a girl
with a discoloured iris

and your first thought is she might
have a lizard in her brain?

I can see I'm going
to have to up my game.

p.span: Oh, I get it. I see it.

div.p:
It was easy for your friend
because of her eye.
Because it gives her special powers?

No! Because her face
isn't symmetrical. Look!

Your face looks wrong,
because it looks right.

What's the one thing you never see
when you look in a reflection?

Your face. You never see your face
the right way round.

Right. Look for a freckle
or a funny tooth.

See, your friend saw it
straightaway because of her eye.

There's something
in the water pretending to be you.

Now what are these?
Let's have a look.

p.span: Let's get you on the bus!

div.p:
Tutorial's over,
take the night off.

It's all cancelled.
Go and be a proper student -

Oh, it's just some freak optical
effect. I'm bored already.

ALIEN VOICE: Passenger selected.
Pursuit engaged.

SHE KNOCKS
I'll make you a cuppa for the bath.

but I think we both know
it's time I treated myself.

Why would I be back with
Neville after last time?
Why do you think I'm such an idiot?
Well, you're calling from his phone.

Is there someone staying here
in the flat?

Of course not, no.
What are you talking about?

Er...nothing, never mind.
I'll see you tomorrow.

Because she's with Neville,
and it's not my fault.

Sorry, I need to know
who's in there.

If that's Barry, let's not make
this worse. Just say it's you.
I'll tell you what it isn't.
It isn't a freak optical effect...
No, no, what are you doing?

I'll tell you what,
let's just pop into my box.

Your box? What good is getting
in your box going to do?

What an extraordinarily long and
involved answer this is going to be.

How do we stop it getting in?
We're trapped in here!
Look, this is all mad, I know.

But that's the girl
I told you about - Heather...

..only I don't think
it's really her.
I know this is hard to believe.

I know you're not exactly
a sci-fi person...

Time And Relative
Dimension In Space.

You're safe in here
and you always will be.

A what?
A really posh kitchen, all metal.

What happened with the doors,
though? Did you run out of money?

What you are standing in
is a technological marvel.

This is the gateway to everything
that ever was...or ever can be.

It's down there, first right, second
left, past the macaroon dispenser.

Oh, human! Human alert.
Do you want me to repel her?

She's just passing through.
She wants to use the toilet.

Oh. I'd give it a minute
if I were you.

We have an incursion on campus.
Extra-terrestrial.

Oh, my God!
This isn't just a room, is it?
No, it's not just a room.

No interference here, as far as
I can see. The vault's secure.
It can go anywhere it likes?

Anywhere at all,
in the whole university?

Is it my imagination, or is this
taking longer than normal?
The room's still inside the box.

Doctor! It's bigger on the inside
than it is on the outside!

How is that possible?
How do you do that?

Well, first, you have
to imagine a very big box
fitting inside a very small box.
OK. Then you have to make one.

It's the second part people
normally get stuck on.
Can we shut up, please? Busy, busy.

I need to know if there's any
interest in what's inside
this vault. Why, what's inside it?

Something I don't want anyone
being too curious about.

So you put it in the middle
of a university?

Either the creature came here
specifically for what's in here,
Well, we can't know that for sure.

Yeah, we can. It was here
for ages before it did anything.

If it had work to do,
why would it lie around in a puddle?

p.span: I don't know, maybe it's a student.

div.p:
..we need to move away from
the doors and towards the TARDIS.

It means it's not interested
in what's inside the vault.
It just wants to kill us.

It's not interested in the vault,
it's chasing us.
Let's give it a proper challenge,

let's see how far
she's prepared to go.

But what about my friend, what
about Heather? Can you save her?

First things first.
Let's see if we can survive her.

Definitely day. Oh, my God!
Have we travelled in time?

No, of course not.
We've travelled to Australia.
How are you doing? How do you think?

p.span: Can I ask you a personal question?

div.p:
I'm from a planet
like everybody else.

TARDIS. If you're from another
planet, why would you name your box

in English? Those initials wouldn't
work in any other language!

People don't generally bring
that up. It looks like a phone box.

Yes, well, that's the cloaking
device. It sort of hides itself.

It's hidden itself as a box
with "pull to enter" on the front?

Uh-huh. It's stuck. It's supposed
to blend in, but it's broken.

Out, out, everybody out,
shark attack!

As far as we can.
She made Australia in a minute -
let's see what she can really do.

Sir, we're leaving Earth.
What about the vault?

If there's any trouble,
I'll get a message on this.

Let's see how long it takes her
to get here.
Oh, yes, it's a time machine too.

That's different sky?
Is it made of something different?

What is sky made of? Lemon drops.
Really?
No, but wouldn't that be nice?

You can be very silly sometimes,
do you know that?

So how do we know this...
water thing is actually dangerous?

Mm, that's true.
Why? Is everything out here evil?

Hardly anything is evil,
but most things are hungry.

Hunger looks very like evil
from the wrong end of the cutlery.

Or do you think that your bacon
sandwich loves you back?

So what is it
and what was it doing on Earth?

Well, there were scorch marks
on the concrete where we found it.

Could have been left
by a shuttle craft.
The puddle, what did it look like?

If that was a car,
what would you say that was?

Intelligent oil.
Super intelligent space oil.

No, part of the ship itself.
Shape-shifting fluid that becomes

But it spent ages laying around,
being a puddle, what changed?

She looked into it, didn't she?
More than once.

Maybe it saw something it needed.
What was she like, your friend?

What did she want?
What did she need?

Everywhere I go,
I just want to leave.
I think she wanted to leave.

A left-behind droplet
of a liquid spaceship.

A single tear drop,
alone in a strange world.

Then, one day, it finds someone
who wants to fly away.

more than a passenger -
it found a pilot, so it ate her.

So why is it chasing this one?
Everything wants, everything needs.
But why does it want her?

I don't know.
I don't know everything, Nardole.

p.span: I don't have it all written down.

div.p:
I act like I do, because I don't.
It must be looking for something.

p.span: Of course it is, everything is.

div.p:
What, in the end are any of us
looking for?

We're looking for someone
who's looking for us.
Hey, still making eyes at a puddle?

OK, it's fast. It time travels,
it never gives up.

We're going to run that thing
through the deadliest fire

The deadliest fire in the universe.
That's definitely good.

The only way we can. We run through
it first. Less good now.

No, not there.
I don't like it there!

I want you running interference.
Can you do that?

Can I say no, sir? No.
Yes, then. Thank you.
But no really. Where are we?

Well, we're basically
in the middle of a war.

No... Well, it's a war zone, and
this is just your basic skirmish,

and it's not as bad as
it sounds, I promise you.

Come on, I've got friends here,
old friends. Oh...

p.span: Are we still in the future?

div.p:
Are we safe here? Well, that's up
to Nardole, so probably not.

Never mind them,
it's who they're firing at.

What's that?
The deadliest fire in the universe.
Scan this device and identify me!

You are the Doctor.
You are an enemy of the Daleks!

What was that thing?
A Dalek. A what? A Dalek.

That's wrong. I know
my Daleks, and that's wrong.

I've sealed the area,
all the Daleks are quarantined...
It's OK. This isn't a Dalek.

Heather. Interesting, you had
a gun but you didn't use it. Why?

You've already taken one
person from the Earth.

I'm going to let that pass,
because I have to,
but I will not let you take another.

You what? The last thing
she said to me.

She promised she
wouldn't leave without me.

Her last conscious thought,
driving her across the universe.
Oh, you don't have to tell me!

She's not chasing you,
she's inviting you.
You have to let me go.
You have to let me go.
Listen, please, just listen to him.

Whatever she's showing you,
whatever she's letting you see.
It's a lure, it's a trap.

She's making you part of her,
and you can never come back.
Bill, let go! You have to let go!
She is not human any more.

That's the Doctor for you.
Never notices the tears.

The vault alarm went off,
but it was nothing.

A student was sick outside and it
registered as a biological attack.
I saw it all for a moment...

She was going to let me fly
with her. She was inviting me.

Scared is rational.
She wasn't human any more.

No, no, no. No, no.
You have to forget about that.
I don't see how I can.

p.span: I just want to fix something.

div.p:
Don't worry. This won't hurt at all.
No, but tell me. Nothing.

Yeah, cos I think you're going
to wipe my memory.

You don't think anyone's ever
seen a movie.

p.span: I know what a mind-wipe looks like!

div.p:
I'm here for a reason, I'm in
disguise. I have promises to keep.
This is the most exciting thing

that's ever happened to me in
my life. The only exciting thing!

OK. Let me remember just
for a week. Just a week.

OK, well, just for tonight.
Just one night.

Come on, let me have some good
dreams for once.
Do what you've got to do.

..just imagine how it would feel
if someone did this to you.

You can keep your memories.
Now get out before I change my mind!

Don't speak, don't start,
just run! Now. Go!

Will you all please
just leave me alone?

I can't do that any more.
I promised!

It's a big universe,
but maybe one day we'll find her.

This is one of Earth's
first colonies.
That is a robot. It speaks emoji!
And where are all the people?

I'm having this really childish
impulse to blow it up.

You're the one who should
be afraid. Never.

I've been standing by the gates of
your world, keeping you all safe.
I'm not stopping now. Any questions?
